headline.main: As Fellow Traveler of Other Illness, Depression Often Goes in Disguise

docs.lead_paragraph: Depression, which experts say is an often underdiagnosed and untreated mental disorder afflicting millions of Americans, has another overlooked dimension. The ailment is also an unrecognized complicating factor in other mental and physical illnesses, specialists say. More doctors are beginning to realize that undiagnosed depression can be not only an underlying component of substance abuse, eating disorders and other conditions, but also an unseen consequence of other seemingly unrelated diseases, and that it can seriously interfere withtreatment and rehabilitation.
